snippet: The House on Friday approved a bill that would help normalize trade relations with Russia but that includes severe penalties for human rights abusers there.
abstract: House of Representatives approves bill that will help normalize trade relations with Russia; includes provision that seeks to punish Russians who are implicated in human rights abuses; inspired by case of Sergei L Magnitsky, Russian lawyer who was tortured and died in prison after investigating government corruption, bill would allow United States to deny visas to Russian officials who are deemed abusers and to freeze their assets.

byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The House on Friday approved a bill that would help normalize trade relations with Russia but that includes severe penalties for human rights abusers there.

headline.seo: House Passes Russia Trade Bill With Sanctions for Rights Abuses
headline.main: House Passes Russia Trade Bill With Eye on Rights Abuses
headline.print_headline: House Passes Russia Trade Bill With Eye on Rights Abuses

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
